posts.author: HipRedux
posts.content:
Rule of thumb:  Fighter for an extra feat or 2 plus EWS, CoT for saves (in this case, CoT 14 means +7 to universal saves).  Also, CoT bonus offers Grt WIS so this could be built more defensively if needed.

Divine Wrath is hardly a feat to build around in anything but a CHA-focused high-CoT build like a smiter or a spellsword synergy with a sorc or bard.  A once-per-day advantage for a few rounds is good mainly for an encounter with a boss with lots of damage resistance but the duration will expire just about the time it seems to be doing some good. 

Epic Dodge requires 30 allocated ranks in Tumble so the earliest it can be taken is Level 27.  Your build needs some adjustment.

A build like this usually focuses on DWing kamas because the APR can become so high (and especially since each kama can contain different OnHit properties in the same round) and the kamas can be keened either by item property or a friendly mage.  But the bludgeoning option can come in handy so it's a trade-off.

Is the bracers of armor the same one that hastes and caps DEX and STR?  If not, you lose the +5 armor AC when you swap out for the uber gloves.  But in Expertise mode, you'll get the AC back again.

posts.author: Empyre65
posts.content: If a Halfling dual-wields kamas, he will suffer -2 AB relative to a medium-sized player because the off-hand weapon is not one size smaller than the player, much like a Human dual-wielding longswords or another medium-sized weapon.
